prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three purps:
1. Dalmatian
2. toucan
3. pig

Now pick out the other purps from the following list:
1. pumpkin
2. car
3. loader
4. green bell pepper
5. box truck
6. basset hound
7. cat
8. carrot
9. bee
10. onion
11. yellow bell pepper
12. Labrador
13. crane
14. full-trailer truck
15. school bus
16. seal
17. chiller truck
18. eggplant
19. Dalmatian
20. bear
21. red bell pepper


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. box truck and Labrador
2. basset hound and chiller truck
3. mutt and pig
4. motorcycle and semi-trailer truck
5. loader and cat
6. motorcycle and red bell pepper
7. red bell pepper and eggplant
8. mutt and yellow bell pepper
9. red bell pepper and carrot
10. semi-trailer truck and chiller truck
11. pumpkin and basset hound
12. potato and school bus
13. red bell pepper and toucan
14. motorcycle and seal
15. green bell pepper and full-trailer truck
16. mutt and car
17. tractor and pumpkin
18. Dalmatian and mutt
19. seal and basset hound
20. motorcycle and yellow bell pepper
21. box truck and cat
22. box truck and pig
23. pumpkin and yellow bell pepper
24. Dalmatian and full-trailer truck
25. box truck and yellow bell pepper
26. basset hound and toucan
27. box truck and toucan
28. green bell pepper and seal
29. basset hound and car
30. crane and garbage truck
31. seal and full-trailer truck
32. mutt and motorcycle
33. green bell pepper and eggplant
34. crane and seal
35. carrot and terrier
36. school bus and full-trailer truck
37. tractor and full-trailer truck
38. mutt and semi-trailer truck
39. basset hound and full-trailer truck
40. basset hound and terrier
41. Labrador and potato
42. green bell pepper and terrier
43. crane and motorcycle
44. red bell pepper and cat
45. garbage truck and yellow bell pepper
46. pumpkin and school bus
47. pig and carrot
48. seal and pig
49. garbage truck and car
50. red bell pepper and terrier


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
